clinical_history: Limb swelling, rule out deep venous thrombosis.
technique: Real-time gray-scale and color Doppler imaging performed.
findings: Right ovary shows mildly thickened appearance.
Right kidney demonstrates enlarged, no hydronephrosis.
Placenta is hypoechoic and normally located.
Major vessels show normal waveform on Doppler.
Testes are well-defined with normal vascularity.
Left kidney shows well-defined, corticomedullary differentiation preserved.
Common bile duct measures 39.25 mm, within normal limits.
Liver appears coarse with no focal lesions.
